property.name: include
property.value: Map:Common Data

property.name: description
property.value: Asgore's home. The story of [[Asriel Dreemurr|Asriel]] and [[Chara|the first human]] ([[Neutral Route]]) and [[Flowey]]'s story ([[Genocide Route]]) begin here.

property.name: page
property.value: Asgore's Home

property.name: description
property.value: A long corridor just before the Throne Room. [[Sans]] conducts his judgement here.

property.name: page
property.value: Last Corridor

property.name: description
property.value: The magical seal trapping the monsters underneath [[Mount Ebott]]. It can only be destroyed with the power of seven human [[SOUL]]s.

property.name: description
property.value: The outside world, inhabited by [[humans]]. [[Monsters]] escape to the Surface at the end of the [[True Pacifist Route]].

property.name: description
property.value: Elevator leading back down to the [[CORE]]. On the [[True Pacifist Route]], this elevator is blocked off by [[Flowey]]'s vines.

property.name: description
property.value: Elevator leading to the entrance to the [[Last Corridor]]. It only becomes usable after reaching the other side.

property.name: description
property.value: Elevator leading back to the start of New Home.

object.name: The story of Asriel and the First Human, part 1

properties.property: A long time ago, [[Chara|a human]] fell into the [[Ruins|RUINS]]. Injured by its fall, the human called out for help.

object.name: The story of Asriel and the First Human, part 2

properties.property: [[Asriel Dreemurr|ASRIEL]], the king's son, heard [[Chara|the human]]'s call. He brought the human back to the castle.

object.name: The story of Asriel and the First Human, part 3

properties.property: Over time, [[Asriel Dreemurr|ASRIEL]] and [[Chara|the human]] became like siblings. The [[Asgore Dreemurr|King]] and [[Toriel|Queen]] treated the human child as their own. The [[underground]] was full of hope.

object.name: The story of Asriel and the First Human, part 4

properties.property: Then... One day... [[Chara|The human]] became very ill.

object.name: The story of Asriel and the First Human, part 5

properties.property: [[Chara|The sick human]] had only one request. To see the flowers from their village. But there was nothing we could do.

object.name: The story of Asriel and the First Human, part 6

properties.property: The next day. The next day. ... [[Chara|The human]] died.

object.name: The story of Asriel and the First Human, part 7

properties.property: [[Asriel Dreemurr|ASRIEL]], wracked with grief, absorbed the human's [[SOUL]]. He transformed into a being with incredible power.

object.name: The story of Asriel and the First Human, part 8

properties.property: With the human [[SOUL]], [[Asriel Dreemurr|ASRIEL]] crossed through the [[barrier]]. He carried the human's body into the sunset. Back to the village of the humans.

object.name: The story of Asriel and the First Human, part 9

properties.property: [[Asriel Dreemurr|ASRIEL]] reached the center of the village. There, he found a bed of [[Golden Flowers|golden flowers]]. He carried [[Chara|the human]] onto it.

object.name: The story of Asriel and the First Human, part 10

properties.property: Suddenly, screams rang out. The villagers saw [[Asriel Dreemurr|ASRIEL]] holding [[Chara|the human]]'s body. They thought that he had killed the child.

object.name: The story of Asriel and the First Human, part 11

properties.property: The humans attacked him with everything they had. He was struck with blow after blow. [[Asriel Dreemurr|ASRIEL]] had the power to destroy them all.

object.name: The story of Asriel and the First Human, part 12

properties.property: But... [[Asriel Dreemurr|ASRIEL]] did not fight back. Clutching [[Chara|the human]]... ASRIEL smiled, and walked away.

object.name: The story of Asriel and the First Human, part 13

properties.property: Wounded, [[Asriel Dreemurr|ASRIEL]] stumbled home. He entered the castle and collapsed. His dust spread across the garden.

object.name: The story of Asriel and the First Human, part 14

properties.property: The kingdom fell into despair. The [[Asgore Dreemurr|king]] and [[Toriel|queen]] had lost two children in one night. The humans had once again taken everything from us.

object.name: The story of Asriel and the First Human, part 15

properties.property: The [[Asgore Dreemurr|king]] decided it was time to end our suffering. Every human who falls down here must die. With enough [[SOUL|souls]], we can shatter the [[barrier]] forever.

object.name: The story of Asriel and the First Human, part 16

properties.property: It's not long now. [[Asgore Dreemurr|King ASGORE]] will let us go. King ASGORE will give us hope. King ASGORE will save us all.

object.name: The story of Asriel and the First Human, part 17

properties.property: You should be smiling, too. Aren't you excited? Aren't you happy?

object.name: The story of Asriel and the First Human, part 18

property.name: description
property.value: ''You're going to be free.''

property.name: description
property.value: [[Sans]] judges the protagonist based on their accumulated [[Stats#EXP|EXP]] and [[Stats#LOVE|LOVE]], revealing that they are acronyms for "Execution Points" and "Level of Violence" respectively. If the protagonist had gained no EXP and repeatedly reloads their [[SAVE]] after the judgement, Sans gives them the key to [[Papyrus and Sans's House#Sans's Room|his room]].

property.name: description
property.value: The coffins for the [[Eight Humans#seven fallen humans]] that came before the protagonist. The nearest one is labeled with the name of [[Chara|the first human]]. At the end of the [[True Pacifist Route]], they are open and empty.

property.name: description
property.value: The protagonist first meets Asgore here as he is watering the [[Golden Flowers]]. On the [[Neutral Route]], he guides them to the [[Barrier]].

property.name: page
property.value: Asgore Dreemurr

property.name: description
property.value: At the end of the True Pacifist Route, The protagonist's friends gather here and celebrate the destruction of the [[Barrier]].

property.name: page
property.value: True Pacifist Route#Epilogue

property.name: description
property.value: After defeating [[Photoshop Flowey]], the protagonist is given the option to finish him off. If they kill him, his corpse is left behind, having turned back into a regular flower.

property.name: description
property.value: The game ends after leaving the [[Underground]]. [[Sans]] calls the protagonist's phone and explains the state of the [[Underground]] after [[Asgore Dreemurr|Asgore]]'s death.

property.name: page
property.value: Neutral Route

property.name: description
property.value: The protagonist approaches [[Asgore Dreemurr|Asgore]], who was warned by [[Flowey]] that they would be arriving soon. The protagonist forcibly engages in a battle against Asgore and depletes his HP in a single strike. Flowey finishes him off and begs for his life, but the protagonist kills him as well. [[Chara|The first human]] reveals themself, thanks the protagonist for bringing them back from death, and destroys the game world.

property.name: page
property.value: Genocide Route

property.name: description
property.value: The protagonist and their friends watch the sunset. [[Asgore Dreemurr|Asgore]] asks the protagonist to act as the ambassador to the humans, which they can accept or decline. As their friends make their way down the mountain, [[Toriel]] asks the protagonist if they want to stay with her, altering the post-credits scene.

property.name: page
property.value: True Pacifist Route

property.name: description
property.value: A Dimensional Box outside [[Asgore's Home]], only available on the [[Genocide Route]].

property.name: page
property.value: Dimensional Box

property.name: description
property.value: A Dimensional Box in the [[Last Corridor]], only available on the [[Genocide Route]].

property.name: page
property.value: Dimensional Box

property.name: description
property.value: SAVE Point near the elevator.

property.name: description
property.value: SAVE Point outside [[Asgore's Home]].

property.name: description
property.value: SAVE Point in the [[Last Corridor]].

property.name: description
property.value: SAVE Point outside the Throne Room.

property.name: description
property.value: SAVE Point in the Throne Room.

property.name: description
property.value: SAVE Point outside the [[Barrier]].

properties.property: Howdy! I'm in the garden. If you have anything you need to get off your chest, please don't hesitate to come. The keys are in the kitchen and the hallway.

property.name: description
property.value: ''Howdy! Help yourself to anything you want!''

property.name: description
property.value: ''Throne Room''

property.name: description
property.value: The protagonist can open this present to reveal a [[Worn Dagger]] ([[Neutral Route]]) or the [[Real Knife]] ([[Genocide Route]]).

property.name: description
property.value: The protagonist can open this present to reveal a [[Heart Locket]] ([[Neutral Route]]) or [[The Locket]] ([[Genocide Route]]).

property.name: description
property.value: A key in the hallway. It is used to unlock the chain blocking off the stairs.

property.name: description
property.value: A key in the kitchen. It is used to unlock the chain blocking off the stairs.

property.name: description
property.value: Boss battle against Sans on the [[Genocide Route]].

property.name: page
property.value: Sans/In Battle

property.name: description
property.value: Boss battle against [[Asgore Dreemurr]]. On the [[Neutral Route]], [[Flowey]] finishes him off and absorbs the six human [[SOUL]]s, transforming into [[Photoshop Flowey]]. On the [[True Pacifist Route]], the protagonist's friends interrupt the battle, but Flowey absorbs the human SOULs as well as the SOULs of every monster in the [[Underground]], transforming into [[Asriel Dreemurr]].

property.name: page
property.value: Asgore Dreemurr/In Battle
